intro: Spergula arvensis subsp. sativa, commonly known as common mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb characterized by its small, oval leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it is known for its ability to tolerate a variety of environmental conditions. The species is widely distributed across Europe and parts of Asia.
